channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-16659] Query plan should reflect hive.spark.use.groupby.shuffle
item.description: It's useful to show the shuffle type used in the query plan. Currently it shows "GROUP" no matter what we set for hive.spark.use.groupby.shuffle.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi, ruili
Could I take it over?

libing sure, thanks for helping.
Some suggestions: instead of enforcing the configuration during RDD plan generation, maybe we can do it while we generate the SparkWork, like in GenSparkUtils.getEdgeProperty.
xuefuz, csun would you mind share your opinions? Thanks.
Agree. Maybe we can have some new edge properties to reflect this, and display them accordingly.

This patch is based on branch-2.3.
With the above changes, I could get the explain result as below.

hive> set hive.spark.use.groupby.shuffle=true;
hive> explain select key, count(val) from t1 group by key;
OK

Thanks libing for working on this. Patch looks good overall. Can you create an RB for it? And a side note is, we usually base the patch against master. If you want to develop for a specific branch, you should name your patch accordingly (refer to this wiki).

I think it's OK to remove the RepartitionShuffler, as it's effectively the same as SortByShuffler w/o total order. csun, xuefuz please let me know if you think otherwise.

Hi, ruili
Thank you for the review!
I checked the latest code on master branch, the current patch could be applied to it directly.
So I won't create a new patch file for the master branch for this Jira.
I will pay attention to it in the future.
